*div1 type="summary"* *p* Amos Edwards to Austin, March 7, 1831. He furnished the money which en- abled Leftwich to get the grant for the Nashville Co. Asks Austin to use influence with the governor to have the grant transferred to him. */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Galveston Bay on Board Schooner Angelia*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="03-07-1831"> March 7th 1831*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir*/p*
*p*I take this favourable opportunity of writing *person_mentioned*By Col. Langworthy*/person_mentioned* a Gentleman of high respectability from *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned* who is now on his way to *location_mentioned*Matamoros */location_mentioned*and possibly may go as far as *location_mentioned*Saltillio */location_mentioned*and if he does will hand you this himself, otherwise will forward it from *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*, as I have but a few minutes to write before the departure of the vessel, must come to the subject at once and be brief. I named to you *date_mentioned n="Fall-1830">last fall */date_mentioned*that I had expended upwards of $12000 in obtaining the *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*made to the *person_mentioned*Nashville Company*/person_mentioned* and my share of the expenses since, and emigrated to this *location_mentioned*Country */location_mentioned*with my large *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*nearly three years ago for the purpose of aiding in colonizing sd *location_mentioned*grant */location_mentioned*which has cost me much more money and as none of the *person_mentioned*Company */person_mentioned*except myself and *person_mentioned*Doctor Heard */person_mentioned*emigrated to this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and they have done nothing towards colonizing but have sold out their shares to *person_mentioned*speculators */person_mentioned*who will probably try to get the *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*for themselves exclusively and leave me to suffer my losses, although the *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*never would have been obtained for the *person_mentioned*Company */person_mentioned*had I not furnished the man and the funds. I advanced *person_mentioned*Leftwich */person_mentioned*$6500 previous to his departure for *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*and my *person_mentioned*brother */person_mentioned*furnished him $5000 at *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Saltillio */location_mentioned*on my acct which I have accounted with him for since, and had it not been for these funds he could not have succeeded but must have been imprisoned for his expenses as the *person_mentioned*Company */person_mentioned*did not furnish him with half enough. I therefore think and hope that if the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*will grant that*location_mentioned* tract of country */location_mentioned*to any person they will give the preference to me who is the greatest sufferer by the enterprise and has done everything in my power to get the *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*colonized, and I must request the favor of you to be so good as to aid me in every way in your power in obtaining a *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*for the *location_mentioned*same boundary of land that was granted to *person_mentioned*H H. League*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* as *person_mentioned*Empresario */person_mentioned*for the *person_mentioned*Nashville Company*/person_mentioned*, and I will engage to colonize it with one thousand *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*within six years one half of whom shall be *person_mentioned*Europeans*/person_mentioned*, and I wish the *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*to be upon the same conditions as the one named, in every other respect or as near as will be consistent with the laws of the *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*. I hope you will act as my *person_mentioned*agent */person_mentioned*in this matter and draught and present a petition for the *location_mentioned*grant */location_mentioned*for me and in my name and sign my name to it and do such other things as is necessary in the business relative to obtaining sd grant and this shall be your authority as fully as if I had made you a regular power of atto. as I have not time now to make one. I have no hesitation in saying to you that I feel confident in having the whole number of *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*on the *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*within half the time of six years but it is preferable to have time enough.*/p*
*p*It will be of great importance to the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and great advantage to your *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*and all the *location_mentioned*lower country*/location_mentioned* to have that section of *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*settled as early as possible by agricultural people as they will soon be able to supply the *location_mentioned*lower country*/location_mentioned* with flour etc. which we are now compelled to import from the*location_mentioned* U. S. Of America */location_mentioned*and it will also be the means of driving back all the *person_mentioned*tribes of hostile Indians*/person_mentioned* who are now constantly committing some depredations on the *location_mentioned*Settlements */location_mentioned*of yours and *location_mentioned*Dewits Colony*/location_mentioned*s. You know me personally and my standing in the *location_mentioned*U. S. of America */location_mentioned*and you have seen the testimonials of my character which I obtained from several of the most disinterested *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*in the*location_mentioned* U. States of A*/location_mentioned*. which I would forward with this but left them with *person_mentioned*Col. Bradburn*/person_mentioned* to have them translated and cannot now get them in time but will forward them to the *person_mentioned*Executive of this State*/person_mentioned* as early as possible. A letter from *person_mentioned*Col. Nelson Patteson one of the Directors of the Nashville Company and secretary of the Directory*/person_mentioned* addressed to *person_mentioned*Majr Hose [a] H League*/person_mentioned* will accompany this which you will be so good as to translate and show to the *person_mentioned*Executive and the Honble Congress*/person_mentioned* which will satisfy them in what estimation I was held by the *person_mentioned*Directory of the Nashville Company*/person_mentioned* as it was written at their meeting just before my departure from thence and it will prove to them that I disapproved of the conduct of my *person_mentioned*brothers */person_mentioned*relative to the revolution at *location_mentioned*Nacogdoches*/location_mentioned*—and the testimonials which I brought from *person_mentioned*Judge G. P. M. Bibb*/person_mentioned* will prove that I have never been in favour of insurrections which you recollect and was good enough to translate on the back of it. I hope and trust that the *person_mentioned*Government */person_mentioned*will remunerate me for the sum of money I have expended about that *location_mentioned*Grant */location_mentioned*with the purest intentions of becoming serviceable to the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*as well as my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*by aiding in the colonizing and improving of it as much as was in my power, and grant me the *location_mentioned*same tract of country*/location_mentioned* and I trust that you will give me all the aid in your power to effect that object, and your friendship and attention to the Business will be ever duly appreciated and gratefully acknowledged by*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Amos Edwards*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] The *person_mentioned*Honble Estevan F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Saltillio*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
